MS MCQs

    Configure your Windows app to use Narrator and speech recognition - Summary

    »

    1. What UI element property is checked for and used by the Narrator first?

      x:Name

      Content

      AutomationPropertes.HelpText

      AutomationProperties.Name


    2. What two permissions need to be set for voice recognition to work?

      Microphone and speech recognition.

      Microphone and two-factor authentication.

      Protocol and speech recognition.

      Accessibility and speech synthesis.


    3. What happens when you clearly say, without pauses, “three times twenty equals” to the Windows speech recognition tool, with the calculator in focus?

      The calculator display shows “3 * 20”.

      The calculator display shows “60”.

      The calculator display shows “3”.

      The speech recognition tool shows “What was that”.


    4. What happens when you clearly say, without pauses, “three times twenty equals” to the calculator’s custom speech recognition tool?

      The calculator display shows “3 * 20”.

      The calculator display shows “60”.

      The calculator display shows nothing.

      The calculator display shows “3 times”.
